results.title: Winners : The Paper Boy (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
During the Depression, Joe’s father gets the sack. The only money the family has is what 13 year old Joe earns from selling papers. Then Joe has a fight with his father and leaves home. He lives on the streets battling with his wits and his fists as he gets to know the characters of the city - the down and outs, the Communist agitators, the Sallies, and Old Harry.

results.title: Winners : Just friends (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Winners Series”.
Susan has just moved to a new part of town. It’s school holidays and she goes to practise her skills at the local roller rink. Buzz, the Prince of the rink, spots the talented newcomer and moves in on her. Susan joins Buzz and his gang - but she doesn’t know what she is letting herself in for.

results.title: Harry the dirty dog
results.brief_description: Harry, a white dog with black spots enjoys playing in the sprinklers, climbing trees, and especially doing tricks. His first adventure is with an overturned trash can, and eventually he is picked up by a garbage truck and carried to a far away dump. Many adventures later he returns home, a dirtier, wiser dog. Based on the book by Gene Zion.

results.title: My survival as an Aboriginal
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Martha Ansara, Essie Coffey and Goodgabah Productions
results.brief_description: After being forced from their tribal grounds, the Murrowarri were dumped onto a tiny reserve on the fringe of a white town. In this film Essie Coffey, black activist and musician, shows the conflicts of living as an Aboriginal under white domination. This film is part of her effort to make her community proud of their black identity while struggling to survive.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alec Morgan, Martha Ansara, Essie Coffey and Goodgabah Productions

results.title: Age before beauty
results.creator_credit: Sarah Gibson, Susan Lambert and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Shows older women involved in a variety of activities including exercise classes and dances. Shows them undertaking “alternative” health treatments such as chiropractry and acupuncture. Exposes the negative stereotyping of older women and investigates women’s fear of the aging process.

results.title: What's a good book?: selecting books for children
results.creator_credit: Joanna Foster and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Various librarians and writers give their opinions as to what constitutes good reading material for children. Shows the decision-making process behind the selection of books for children’s libraries and stresses the need to consider why children like particular books. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: A Story, a story
results.creator_credit: Gail E. Hailey, Morton Schindel, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Nyame, the Sky God, demands a high price in exchange for his treasure. How Ananse paid the price is told in narration and woodcuts capturing the flavour of African languages, customs and lifestyles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gail E. Hailey, Morton Schindel, Kratky Film and Weston Woods Studios
